review_text: It's very nicely decorated - cute, bright and charming; we really liked the blinds! The amenities were minimal and very basic. Unfortunately although the furniture looks nice, it was not at all comfortable to sit or sleep on. Also, the bunk beds were noisy and disruptive to sleep. It seems like the most comfortable bed was the queen bed so if that's all you plan to use you should be okay. If you plan to spend a lot of time in the airbnb or plan to do a lot of cooking, this might not be the one for you. Not sure if the turnover was rushed or what, but it seemed like some things that may normally get done were lacking (ex: the soap in the bathroom was empty upon arrival; dust/cobwebs on the fans and some other cleanliness issues in the kitchen as well). It was a very quiet neighborhood but still close to Maume Bay State Park and downtown Toledo, which was really nice. The host was responsive to needs and provided what was lacking in relatively short order. It was disappointing to learn that although you can see the water from the house, it's not actually on the water nor can you access the water from the house. Also, be advised that the Air Conditioning is only supplied by window units and there isn't one in the bunk bed room. Wifi was somewhat spotty. Easy access to Oregon Inn (a nearby restaurant), in unit laundry, off street parking, great cancellation policy, and access to major streaming services were some nice features of this listing.
